channel.title: The Titanic
channel.description:
Well, I've seen the movie, and I've read all the books, and I'm actually pretty interested in it.
For those of you who know about it, should the captain of the SS Californian have looked more into the lights they were seeing before retreating to bed for the night? Should their wireless operator have stayed up instead of going to bed? Do you think this could have saved many more lives?
I want to here what everyone has to think, so [b][u]DISCUSS[/u][/b].

item.title: The Titanic
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It’s been a very long time since I’ve watched the movie. Would have been 10 or so actually, so nearly 7 years ago. I don’t remember some of the things you guys have mentioned from it, like what the Captain did and so on - I guess being 10 I didn’t understand it all. =\

But it was one of those good movies. The only other movie that was good in that way was Gladiator, which is one of those movies you can watch again and again.

Read full topic

item.title: The Titanic
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Ya I think everyone could have been saved, maybe except the ones that were trapped within the boat. Because there were those who got closed within the watertight doors, which would have been like torture

Read full topic

item.title: The Titanic
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Well, obviously that Cap’n should of looked more in to the lights. Although, I assume I’d probably think of the flares as fireworks. So yes, if the Captain did find out that they were not fireworks, rather emergency flares, lives would of been saved.

Read full topic
